extendedInfo.description: Claude Monet, born Oscar Claude Monet (14 November 1840 â 5 December 1926), was a founder of French impressionist painting, and the most consistent and prolific practitioner of the movement's philosophy of expressing one's perceptions before nature, especially as applied to plein-air landscape painting. The term Impressionism is derived from the title of his painting Impression, Sunrise (Impression, soleil levant).

reviews.title: BRIGHT SECRET
reviews.comment: What made Claude Monet and Vincent Van Gogh click and tick? The bright secret of the birth of impressionism was the supreme suppleness of their emotions along with their marvellous elastic frame of mind...FROM JAMES MICHAEL CHAPESKIE
reviews.author: A Google User
